article_text:
Rapid City, SD

In Rapid City, city crews closed parts of the bike path Sunday after more than an inch of rain added to the levels of Rapid Creek.

The creek was already flowing at two to three times the normal rate. The additional rain pushed it out of its banks at locations all through the city.

Rapid City officials warn people to use caution near the creek and watch for flash floods and water over streets and highways elsewhere. Similar warnings were issued elsewhere in the Black Hills, where 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen over the weekend.

article_summary:
Rapid City, SDIn Rapid City, city crews closed parts of the bike path Sunday after more than an inch of rain added to the levels of Rapid Creek.
Rapid City officials warn people to use caution near the creek and watch for flash floods and water over streets and highways elsewhere.
Similar warnings were issued elsewhere in the Black Hills, where 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen over the weekend.
The additional rain pushed it out of its banks at locations all through the city.
The creek was already flowing at two to three times the normal rate.
